subject: Evp Listener???---Radio Shack Parts
author: urkel23@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1228004543
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I think Mike C. posted a simlar e-mail a while back, but i wanted to  
re-visit the theory.
    
_http://cgi.ebay.com/EVP-Listener-Ghost-Box-GHOST-HUNTERS-TAPS-OVILUS_W0QQitem
Z270310065859QQcmdZViewItemQQptZLH_DefaultDomain_0?hash=item270310065859&_trks
id=p3286.c0.m14&_trkparms=72%3A1205%7C66%3A2%7C65%3A12%7C39%3A1%7C240%3A1318_ 
(http://cgi.ebay.com/EVP-Listener-Ghost-Box-GHOST-HUNTERS-TAPS-OVILUS_W0QQitem
Z270310065859QQcmdZViewItemQQptZLH_DefaultDomain_0?hash=item270310065859&_trks
id=p3286.c0.m14&_trkparms=72:1205|66:2|65:12|39:1|240:1318) 
 
This is an item i'm sure most have seen on ebay by now, what this does is  
convert emf and other electrical sources into audible sounds.  Now----If  the 
theory is true than if EMF detectors pick up spirit than a microphone for  EMF 
should pick up spirit voices...Right???
 
I have broken down this by part #'s and it's easily sourced at the local  
radio shack to test out.  I've had this for years now, but haven't  experimented 
enough with it.  Here's the part #'s you would need:
 
44-533 ---Microphone
 
_http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2103876&tab=summary_ 
(http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2103876&tab=summary) 
 
and
 
277-1008 ---Amplifier
 
_http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2062620_ 
(http://www.radioshack.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2062620) 
 
Headphones are optional.
 
I have another idea for those with MiniBoxes with a mic jack.   Couldn't we 
plug this $8 microphone into the jack and pick up 50/60hz energy  sources while 
sweeping the AM radio band.  I just tried it with the mic  jack on my frank's 
box and got some interesting results.
 
Just something to think about,
 
-Steve H.
